Node¶

class feastruct.fea.node.Node(id, coord)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for a node to be used in finite element analyses.

A node object is defined by its position in cartesian space and can store nodal displacement results from a static analysis, as well as eigenvector results from an eigenvalue analysis.

Variables:
  • id (int) – Unique node id
  • coord (list[float, float]) – Cartesian coordinates of the node
  • dofs (list[float, float, float]) – Global degree of freedom numbers to be used in an analysis
  • fixity (list[float, float, float]) – A list containing fixities for the nodal degrees of freedom for post-processing visualisation of nodal supports
  • u (feastruct.post.results.ResultList) – Nodal displacement results for static analyses
  • buckling_v (feastruct.post.results.ResultList) – Eigenvector results for buckling analyses
  • frequency_v (feastruct.post.results.ResultList) – Eigenvector results for frequency analyses
__init__(id, coord)[source]¶

Inits the Node class.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – Unique node id
  • coord (list[float, float]) – Cartesian coordinates of the node
get_buckling_results(case_id, buckling_mode)[source]¶

Returns the eigenvalue (w) and nodal eigenvector (v) for the buckling analysis defined by case_id and the buckling mode defined by buckling_mode.

Parameters:
  • case_id (int) – Unique case id
  • buckling_mode (int) – Buckling mode number
Returns:

(w, v)
Return type:

tuple(float, numpy.ndarray)

set_buckling_results(case_id, buckling_mode, w, v)[source]¶

Saves the buckling eigenvalue and nodal eigenvector for the buckling analysis defined by case_id and the buckling mode defined by buckling_mode.

  • buckling_mode (int) – Buckling mode number

Saves a displacement vector for the analysis defined by case_id.

Parameters:

  • u (numpy.ndarray) – Nodal displacement vector
